Loved not only the food but also the service! I had to come early & wait for my family, they were very accommodating & made sure I am comfortable. Food (everything I ordered) was tasty, good portion (one item fills you up), reasonably price, prepared pretty quick (within 15 min, meal was served for all 5 people). They went above & beyond to fill our need & served every request with grace. They even offered complimentary rice & salad. Very appreciative of the chef as well as the server. We are always up for a good plate of Nepalese momos, and this place did not disappoint. Portions are small, and there are 6 momos per plate, so you may need a few plates if you're hungry! The chicken noodles were pretty good as well. We went on a Saturday afternoon and most of the tables were empty. Would definitely visit again if we happen to be in the area. Great, tasty Indian/Nepalese food. We ordered the chicken fried rice, chicken tikka masala, and garlic naan - they were all scrumptious and hit the spot. I asked for medium level spiciness and they nailed it. The garlic naan is made in house, from scratch and it was the most delicious garlic naan (or any naan for that matter) I've ever had. The service is great too. I wish they'd get more customers because they deserve it. Disappointing Experience at Himalayan House

Food Quality
- Ordered Chicken Karahi, but it had a bad smell, making it unpleasant to eat.
- Requested green chili, but was given only a tiny quarter-sized piece after a long wait.

Customer Service
- The employee's attitude was unprofessional, creating a poor impression.
- Slow service and lack of attention to customer requests.

Guest Experience
- Brought my guest expecting a good meal, but one of them experienced vomiting afterward.
- Felt mistreated, especially as someone from India/Nepal, making the visit uncomfortable.

Final Verdict
Based on this visit, I **do not recommend** this restaurant, especially for South Asian guests, as the overall experience was disappointing. Service Dine in Price per person $30‚Äì50 Food: 1 Service: 1 Atmosphere: 1 Wait time 10-30 min

I had their mutton thali and it was the worst thali I ever had in my life.It was overpriced and the thali had only 3 piece of meat and the quality of the rice was also very bad it was like we were chewing plastic.

Replied to owners reply : first try to be professional you cant say dont come back to customer just because we made you realise how deep is your restaurant. Try to focus on improving, instead of losing a customer. Literally your food sucks. Rice was like a chewing plastic and thats the fact. I guess we expected more from a nepali restaurant. Dont give the bad quality food and spoil the image of Nepali thali for saving few bucks. I suggest you try some nepali food from texas DFW and get inspired. Aba ofcourse khana nai 5-6 chamchi jati diyesi 3-4 choti thapi halxa ni. Good luck never coming again.

I had their mutton thali and it was the worst thali I ever had in my life.It was overpriced and the thali had only 3 piece of meat and the quality of the rice was also very bad it was like we were chewing plastic.

Replied to owners reply : first try to be professional you cant say dont come back to customer just because we made you realise how deep is your restaurant. Try to focus on improving, instead of losing a customer. Literally your food sucks. Rice was like a chewing plastic and thats the fact. I guess we expected more from a nepali restaurant. Loved not only the food but also the service! I had to come early & wait for my family, they were very accommodating & made sure I am comfortable. Food (everything I ordered) was tasty, good portion (one item fills you up), reasonably price, prepared pretty quick (within 15 min, meal was served for all 5 people). They went above & beyond to fill our need & served every request with grace. They even offered complimentary rice & salad. Very appreciative of the chef as well as the server. Great, tasty Indian/Nepalese food. We ordered the chicken fried rice, chicken tikka masala, and garlic naan - they were all scrumptious and hit the spot. I asked for medium level spiciness and they nailed it. The garlic naan is made in house, from scratch and it was the most delicious garlic naan (or any naan for that matter) I've ever had. The service is great too. I wish they'd get more customers because they deserve it. Disappointing Experience at Himalayan House

Food Quality
- Ordered Chicken Karahi, but it had a bad smell, making it unpleasant to eat.
- Requested green chili, but was given only a tiny quarter-sized piece after a long wait.

Customer Service
- The employee's attitude was unprofessional, creating a poor impression.
- Slow service and lack of attention to customer requests.

Guest Experience
- Brought my guest expecting a good meal, but one of them experienced vomiting afterward.
- Felt mistreated, especially as someone from India/Nepal, making the visit uncomfortable.

Final Verdict
Based on this visit, I **do not recommend** this restaurant, especially for South Asian guests, as the overall experience was disappointing. Service Dine in Price per person $30‚Äì50 Food: 1 Service: 1 Atmosphere: 1 Wait time 10-30 min

The first time I came, pre Covid-19, it was Indian owned, everyone was very welcoming and friendly, and the food tasted authenticly Indian.  It was so great and flavorful!

This time, it was very clearly not Indian owned.  The food and the service was alright but, this was my second time here and the feel and experience was completely different.  Nothing like before!

If I do return, it would be solely based on location and convenience. Service Dine in Price per person $10‚Äì20 Food: 3 Service: 3 Atmosphere: 3 Wait time No wait
